contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:Luther46c.jpg|Martin Luther File:Dd245reubenjames.jpg|USS Reuben James (DD-245) File:Mountrushmore.jpg|Mount Rushmore </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1587]] – '''[[Leiden University Library]]''' in [[Leiden]] in the Netherlands opened its doors, becoming one of the significant cultural centres in Europe during the [[Age of Enlightenment]]. | more footnotes |- | [[1863]] – The [[New Zealand land wars]] resumed as British forces in New Zealand led by [[General Officer|General]] [[Duncan Alexander Cameron|Duncan Cameron]] began their '''[[Invasion of Waikato]]''' along the [[Waikato River]]. | Tagged with {{tl|unreferenced}} |- | [[1864]] – '''[[Nevada]]''' was admitted as the 36th U.S. state, in part to help ensure [[Abraham Lincoln]]'s [[United States presidential election, 1864|re-election]] as [[President of the United States]] eight days later. | refimprove sections |- | [[1917]] – [[World War I]]: [[Allies of World War I|Allied]] forces defeated [[Ottoman Empire|Turkish]] troops in [[Beersheba]] in Southern [[Palestine]] at the '''[[Battle of Beersheba (1917)|Battle of Beersheba]]''', often reported as "the last successful [[cavalry]] [[charge (warfare)|charge]] in history". | needs more footnotes |- | [[1941]] – More than 101 crew members of the '''[[USS Reuben James (DD-245)|USS ''Reuben James'']]''' ''(pictured)'' perished when their vessel became the first [[United States Navy]] ship sunk by hostile action during [[World War II]] after it was torpedoed by the [[Nazi Germany|German]] submarine ''[[German submarine U-552|U-552]]''. | needs more footnotes |- | [[1997]] – Nineteen-year-old British [[au pair]] '''[[Louise Woodward case|Louise Woodward]]''' was convicted of the [[Manslaughter|involuntary manslaughter]] of eight-month-old Matthew Eappen in [[Newton, Massachusetts]]. | refimprove, Need to verify date |- | [[1999]] – All 217 people on board '''[[EgyptAir Flight 990]]''' were killed when the aircraft suddenly plummeted into the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of [[Nantucket, Massachusetts]], United States. | neutrality disputed |- | [[2000]] – [[Singapore Airlines]] '''[[Singapore Airlines Flight 006|Flight 006]]''' collided with construction equipment while attempting to take off from [[Taiwan]]'s [[Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport]] during heavy rain, killing 79 passengers and 4 crew members. | refimprove section |- | [[2003]] – After 22 years in power, [[Malay titles|Tun]] '''[[Mahathir Mohamad]]''' retired as [[Prime Minister of Malaysia]]. | Tagged with {{tl|POV}} |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1973]] – Three [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] members '''[[Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape|escaped]]''' from [[Mountjoy Prison]] in [[Dublin]] after a hijacked helicopter landed in the prison's exercise yard. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[October 31]]''': '''[[Halloween]]'''; '''[[Samhain]]''' begins (Northern Hemisphere); '''[[Beltane]]''' begins (Southern Hemisphere); '''[[Reformation Day]]''' in [[Protestantism]] <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em;"> [[File:Indira2.jpg|Indira Gandhi|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[1517]] – According to traditional accounts, '''[[Martin Luther]]''' first posted his [[The Ninety-Five Theses|Ninety-Five Theses]] onto the door of the [[All Saints' Church, Wittenberg|Castle Church]] in [[Wittenberg]], present-day Germany, marking the beginning of the [[Protestant Reformation]]. {{*mp}} [[1822]] – Emperor '''[[Agustín de Iturbide]]''' of the [[First Mexican Empire]] dissolved the [[Congress of the Union|Mexican Congress]] and replaced it with a [[military junta]] answerable only to him. {{*mp}} [[1913]] – Public transportation workers in [[Indianapolis|Indianapolis, Indiana]], US, '''[[Indianapolis Streetcar Strike of 1913|went on strike]]''', shutting down [[mass transit]] in the city and sparking riots when [[strikebreaker]]s attempted to restart services. {{*mp}} [[1941]] – Over 400 workers completed the 60-foot ({{Nowrap|18 m}}) [[bust (sculpture)|bust]]s of [[President of the United States|U.S. Presidents]] [[George Washington]], [[Thomas Jefferson]], [[Theodore Roosevelt]], and [[Abraham Lincoln]] at '''[[Mount Rushmore]]''' in [[South Dakota]]. {{*mp}} [[1984]] – [[Prime Minister of India|Indian Prime Minister]] '''[[Indira Gandhi]]''' ''(pictured)'' was [[Assassination of Indira Gandhi|assassinated]]<!--Not bold, refimprove--> by two of her own [[Sikhism|Sikh]] bodyguards, sparking '''[[1984 anti-Sikh riots|anti-Sikh riots]]''' throughout the country. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=October|Day=31}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
